data.question: What is the critical temperature (Tc) for superconductivity in κ-(BETS)2Mn[N(CN)2]3 under moderate pressure?
What type of structure does κ-(BETS)2Mn[N(CN)2]3 have?
What is the space group of κ-(BETS)2Mn[N(CN)2]3?
What method was used to synthesize Mn[N(CN)2]2?
data.answer: Metathesis reaction of MnClO4·6H2O with Na[N(CN)2]

data.question: What is the ratio of eclipsed to staggered conformers in κ-(BETS)2Mn[N(CN)2]3?
What is the effective magnetic moment (μeff) indicated by the Curie constant in κ-(BETS)2Mn[N(CN)2]3?
What is the main difference in the anion layer structure between κ-(BETS)2Mn[N(CN)2]3 and BEDT-TTF salts?
data.answer: κ-(BETS)2Mn[N(CN)2]3 has a polymeric structure with paramagnetic ions Mn2+ connected via dicyanamide bridges, while BEDT-TTF salts have discrete paramagnetic units.

data.question: Why is the superconducting transition in κ-(BETS)2Mn[N(CN)2]3 highly sensitive to a magnetic field?
data.answer: Because the superconducting nature of the transition is ascertained by its high sensitivity to a magnetic field.

data.question: What causes the metal-insulator transition in κ-(BETS)2Mn[N(CN)2]3?
data.answer: The metal-insulator transition is caused by a breakdown of the interlayer transport coherence and strong electron−phonon interactions.

data.question: What is the role of π−d interactions in κ-(BETS)2Mn[N(CN)2]3?
data.answer: π−d interactions play an important role in the system, especially in the context of magnetic properties and phase transformations.

data.question: How does pressure affect the superconducting transition in κ-(BETS)2Mn[N(CN)2]3?
data.answer: Pressure almost completely suppresses the low-temperature increase of resistance and induces a superconducting transition.

data.question: What is the significance of the dihedral angle between neighboring dimers in κ-(BETS)2Mn[N(CN)2]3?
data.answer: The dihedral angle affects the overlapping mode of BETS radical cations in the dimer, which is crucial for superconductivity in κ-type conducting layers.

data.question: Is the superconducting transition in κ-(BETS)2Mn[N(CN)2]3 dependent on the orientation of the magnetic field?
data.answer: Yes, the superconducting transition is highly sensitive to the orientation of the magnetic field.

data.question: Is the crystal structure of κ-(BETS)2Mn[N(CN)2]3 characterized by a single type of conducting layer?
Does κ-(BETS)2Mn[N(CN)2]3 exhibit magnetic properties at room temperature?
Is the metal-insulator transition in κ-(BETS)2Mn[N(CN)2]3 reversible under pressure?
Are the magnetic and conducting properties of κ-(BETS)2Mn[N(CN)2]3 independent of each other?
Is the AFM ordering in κ-(BETS)2Mn[N(CN)2]3 suppressed by applying a magnetic field?
Does the presence of Mn2+ ions in κ-(BETS)2Mn[N(CN)2]3 lead to ferromagnetic interactions?
Is the superconducting state in κ-(BETS)2Mn[N(CN)2]3 achieved without applying any external pressure?
